<TD VALIGN="top" COLSPAN="3"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><A HREF="#txa22170_35">Disclaimers </A></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">41</FONT></TD></TR>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_1"></A>1. &nbsp;Highlights </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_2"></A>1.1 &nbsp;Introduction </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">AEGON has long used embedded value as a management tool for its life
insurance operations. AEGON&#146;s management believes that embedded value, in conjunction with other publicly disclosed financial information, can provide valuable additional information for investors and shareholders to assess a reasonable range
of values inherent in the business. The disclosure includes sensitivity analyses reflecting certain risks and drivers of the realization of embedded value. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Embedded
value life insurance is an estimate of the economic value of a company&#146;s existing life insurance business and is to a large extent actuarially determined. Embedded value life insurance should not be viewed as a substitute for AEGON&#146;s
primary financial statements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Embedded value life insurance represents the contributed capital invested in AEGON&#146;s life operations, <I>available surplus</I> or
<I>adjusted net worth</I> (ANW), and the <I>value of in-force life business </I>(ViF)<I>.</I> The latter equals the present value of expected future profits arising from the existing book of life insurance business, including new business sold in
the reporting period, less the cost of capital. Future new business that is sold after the valuation date is not reflected in this value, although certain assumptions such as unit costs reflect a going concern basis. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Total embedded value </I>(TEV) is an additional measure used by management in considering shareholders&#146; interest in the value of the existing business. TEV represents the
sum of the embedded value life insurance, the IFRS book value of all other business that is not included in EVLI (<I>other activities</I>) and the adjustments in respect of holding companies (<I>holding activities</I>). The holding activities
largely represent the market value of AEGON&#146;s debt, capital securities and other net liabilities. IFRS measures have been used to value the holding activities, as this is the accounting basis on which AEGON&#146;s primary financial statements
are based. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Embedded value life insurance calculations use local regulatory accounting principles rather than company specific accounting principles (e.g. IFRS) as
these regulatory requirements determine when profits can be distributed to shareholders. As the base case, EVLI has been prepared using required capital on the <I>internal surplus basis</I>. This presentation has been adopted, as this is how the
business is managed and is consistent with European Embedded Value (EEV) Principles. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The methodology AEGON uses to calculate EVLI is described in addendum 5. This
methodology is consistent with EEV Principles. This disclosure document is in compliance with the additional guidance on minimum required disclosures of sensitivities and other items under EEV, as published by the CFO Forum in October 2005.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 1 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_3"></A>1.2 &nbsp;Overview of embedded value life insurance and total embedded value
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">A high level overview of embedded value life insurance and total embedded value is contained in table 1. More details on these values, the principles and
assumptions used plus the sensitivity of these values to changes in underlying assumptions are included in this document and should be read carefully in connection with the information presented below. All figures in this document are presented on
an after tax basis unless otherwise stated. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 1 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The value of debt, capital securities and other net liabilities, which includes EUR 3 billion convertible core capital securities
from Vereniging AEGON funded by the Dutch State, decreased (i.e. became more negative) by EUR 0.8 billion as a result of net capital distributions from holdings (EUR (0.6) billion), dividends to shareholders (EUR (0.7) billion) and interest payments
on holding debt (EUR (0.3) billion), the change in other net liabilities (EUR (0.8) billion) somewhat offset by changes in market value of debt (EUR 1.7 billion). The change in other net liabilities was largely a result of a capital contribution of
EUR 0.5 billion to the US &#150; previously this amount had been treated as a loan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_4"></A>1.3 &nbsp;New business
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The profitability of the policies sold in 2008 can be measured by the <I>gross value of new business,</I> which is equal to the <I>value of new business</I>
(VNB) generated by new business sold during the reporting period, grossed up at the relevant corporate tax rate and adjusted for the cost of carrying required capital on the internal surplus basis. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 2 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_5"></A>2. &nbsp;Economic Assumptions </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The economic assumptions for AEGON&#146;s main markets in 2008 and 2007 are presented in table 4. The assumptions are set using a market based approach with rates that can vary by
country unit and change from year to year taking into account available empirical data. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Further detail on the setting of discount rates and the economic assumptions
in other countries is described in addendum 5 and 6 respectively. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 4 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(A)</SUP> Risk free fixed
interest returns correspond to the 10-year government bond yield. The table above shows start rates only. Refer to table 23 for more detail. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(B)</SUP> Average net credit spread in basis points (bps) of all corporate bonds, mortgages, loans, etc. over the 'fixed interest returns'. The table above shows start
rates only. Refer to table 23 for more detail. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">All economic assumptions are reviewed each year and adjusted if appropriate. All assumptions reflect a going
concern. The currency exchange rates are summarized in addendum 4: Exchange rates. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The main changes for 2008 have been a decrease in the short-term risk free fixed
interest return across all countries. Additionally the risk margin to determine equity returns and the discount rate was increased from 3% in 2007 to 4% in 2008 &#150; the exception to this was the Netherlands where the risk margin remained at 3% to
reflect the substantial de-risking of their business profile. The other feature across all countries has been a substantial increase in initial corporate spreads. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_6"></A>3. &nbsp;Reconciliation of total capital base to adjusted net worth </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value life insurance is not based on international financial reporting standards (IFRS). Rather, it is based on local regulatory accounting. As the base case, EVLI
has been prepared using required capital on the internal surplus basis. The following reconciliation presents the adjustments to the total capital base under IFRS to arrive at the ANW that is based on local regulatory accounting rules. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 5 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD></TD>

COLOR="#005cae"><B>Reconciliation of total capital base to ANW</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><I>(amounts in EUR millions)</I></FONT></P></TD>

<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">(5</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">)&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(A)</SUP> Including the preferred
share capital (2008: EUR 2,114&nbsp;million, 2007: EUR 2,114 million). </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(B)</SUP> Including EUR 3 billion convertible core capital securities </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(C)</SUP> Borrowings (of which related to insurance activities): EUR 5,339&nbsp;million (EUR 69 million) in 2008 and EUR 6,021&nbsp;million (EUR 1,255 million) in 2007. </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(D)</SUP> Carried at the holding companies. </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The change in other net liabilities was largely a result of a capital contribution of EUR 0.5 billion to the US &#150; previously this amount had been treated as a loan.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 5 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The capital base is largely invested in the life subsidiaries. The remaining capital allocated to other
activities is included in total embedded value at IFRS book value. In the reconciliation, the capital allocated to life subsidiaries is adjusted to local regulatory accounting. The largest part of the adjustment relates to the non-admissibility on a
regulatory basis of DPAC/VOBA of the modeled life business</FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">4</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">. The life insurance DPACs in certain
countries, most significantly the Netherlands (EUR 0.5 billion), are not eliminated, as they are admissible assets under their regulatory accounting. The impact of the elimination of inadmissible DPAC/VOBA relating to the modeled life business
equals EUR (14.7)&nbsp;billion, asset related differences amount to EUR 8.8 billion, reserve related differences amount to EUR 5.1 billion and the balance of the adjustments, EUR (1.0)&nbsp;billion, is explained by a number of smaller adjustments,
including deferred tax and goodwill on moving from IFRS to regulatory accounting. The asset valuation differences are up substantially from 2007 and arise primarily in the Americas - they reflect the inclusion of unrealized losses in IFRS which is
not required under regulatory reporting. The reserve valuation differences are down on 2007 with the main fall in the Americas resulting from certain liabilities being adjusted to reflect market changes under regulatory accounting but remaining
fixed under IFRS. This is partially offset by a rise in the UK as only statutory reserves for annuities reflect the impact of higher bond yields. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The differences
between embedded value and the accounting treatment of DPAC are discussed in addendum 3. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">4</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"> The non-admissibility of certain assets on a local basis simultaneously decreases equity while increasing future profits as the margins that
are available to amortize these intangible assets on an IFRS basis go straight to the bottom-line under regulatory accounting. In other words, the decrease in equity when going from IFRS to the local basis is largely offset by an increase in the
value of the in-force business. </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 6 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>

<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_7"></A>4. Outcome </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">This section presents the EVLI and TEV as of December&nbsp;31, 2008. All profits are in millions of euro and based on local regulatory accounting net of reinsurance and after tax. The level of required surplus is based on
internal surplus requirements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_8"></A>4.1 &nbsp;Value components </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The values under the internal surplus requirements are: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 6 </I></FONT></P> <P

<TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-bottom:0px; margin-top:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="1"><B>17,194</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="margin-bottom:0px; margin-top:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The solvency requirement on which the business is managed is based on the more stringent of the regulatory requirements and
Standard and Poors&#146; local capital adequacy models at a AA level, plus any additional internally imposed requirements, if applicable. The exception is AEGON&#146;s partnership in France, La Mondiale Participations, which is managed on local
regulatory requirements. This then forms the basis for the solvency requirements for that business throughout this report. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The main areas covered by other
activities are banking (EUR 0.2 billion), distribution (EUR 0.1 billion), general insurance (EUR 0.4 billion) and pensions and employee benefits (EUR 0.2 billion). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">Other activities increased by EUR 0.8 billion. The increase is mainly driven by capital contributions from group to the Americas (EUR 0.5 billion) and the inclusion of a new joint venture in Spain (EUR 0.2 billion). Other activities for the
UK is negative as a result of the staff pension scheme deficit and inter company lending activities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value life insurance decreased due to positive
performance on the in-force business and the contribution from value of new business being more than offset by the negative impact of investment experience and changes in economic assumptions. For a detailed discussion of the change in embedded
value life insurance from end of year 2007 to end of year 2008 refer to section 4.2 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 7 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Non-recurring expenses </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">For all countries, any expected efficiency gains from restructuring programs have not been reflected in the expense assumptions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In established operations,
certain incurred expenses are considered non-recurring. For newer operations, such as China or Czech Republic, the value of new business and the projection of expenses in the embedded value life insurance reflect longer term expected run rate
acquisition and maintenance expenses. In total an amount of EUR 33&nbsp;million, after tax, was considered as exceptional expenses (Americas EUR 11&nbsp;million, UK EUR 5&nbsp;million, Asia EUR 10&nbsp;million and CEE EUR 7 million), and not
included in the derivation of acquisition and maintenance expense assumptions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Employee pension plan costs </I></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Expense assumptions in the embedded value include the cost of providing employee pension benefits where appropriate. The allowance for these costs fully reflects the long-term
cost of providing pensions and is consistent with the allowance for pensions elsewhere in the calculation of the total embedded value. Any pension asset or liability has been included at the IFRS book value. For the Americas, where a pension asset
is already reflected in IFRS book value (in other activities), no contribution holidays with respect to this pension asset are taken into account in the pension contribution expenses in the embedded value. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>2,335</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The economic value of free surplus in the life business increased during 2008 mainly due to: </FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Return on free surplus of EUR 0.1 billion. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Overall release of required surplus on in-force business of EUR 3.3 billion. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In the Americas the high release of EUR 2.2 billion reflected substantial releases from fixed annuities and IGP partially offset by an increase in required capital for
variable annuities. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In the Netherlands the above average earnings of EUR 0.5 billion reflected gains on investments including hedge results linked to falls in interest rates. The above average
release of required surplus of EUR 0.7 billion reflected the lower S&amp;P requirements at the end of 2008 and de-risking the business. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Net capital injections of EUR 0.5 billion. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">partially offset by
</FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Overall earnings on in-force of EUR (0.7) billion. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In the Americas the adverse earnings of EUR (1.2)&nbsp;billion were driven by market impacts on variable annuities, guarantee costs, and IGP. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In the UK the adverse earnings of EUR (0.1) billion mainly reflected a combination of the impact of market falls and a strengthening of default assumptions in statutory
reserving. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Investment in new business including new business strain and required capital on new business of EUR (2.0)&nbsp;billion. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Currency exchange differences of EUR (0.1) billion. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The main components
of other are related to the impact of unrealized losses in the Netherlands and the combination of financial reinsurance and securitization arrangements in the UK. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_9"></A>4.2 Movement analysis of embedded value life insurance </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:4px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The change in embedded value life insurance from year to year is split into the following components</FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">5</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">. The main items per region are explained in further detail after table 8 and table 10. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 8 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

STYLE="margin-top:72px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">5</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"> Refer to
addendum 1 &#146;Movement analysis per region and product segment&#146;, tables 14 to 19, for a split per region and per product segment. </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Return on embedded value </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">The overall embedded value operating margin was 6.8% in 2008 (8.8% in 2007). The embedded value total margin was (13.4)% in 2008 (2.2% in 2007). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3"
COLOR="#005cae"><B>Currency exchange differences </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">A negative currency variance of EUR 315&nbsp;million was primarily caused by a weakening of the British pound
and a number of the CEE currencies against the euro. This was partially offset by a strengthening of the US dollar. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Capital movements
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Capital movements include transfers between life operations, holding activities and non-life operations. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Americas </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value operating margin on a constant currency basis was 5.7%. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In-force variance on mortality and morbidity was favorable across most lines of business. However this was more than offset by adverse spread experience, shown under other,
with some offset from various small items including tax and reserving changes. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The change in operating assumptions was driven by lower lapses in Variable Annuities resulting in higher guarantee costs, reduced prepayment rates on certain general account
assets, offset partially by the adoption of updated mortality tables </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The large negative long-term investment variance reflected losses linked to the decline in equity markets and the impact of widening credit spreads. There was also a smaller
adverse impact from the reduction in fixed interest rates. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The net change in economic assumptions was largely driven by lower fixed interest returns. Adverse impacts from default losses and equity returns were offset by the lower
discount rate. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The miscellaneous impacts reflected a combination of modeling improvements and a change in S&amp;P requirements. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>The Netherlands </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value operating margin was 4.7%. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The main components of the in-force variance were unfavorable expense experience in the Life business due to a combination of a reallocation of costs and a number of short
term project costs, in particular system development linked to policyholder compensation. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The change in operating assumptions reflected a large negative impact from longer assumed longevity in Pensions which more than offset a positive mortality adjustment in
Life. The changes under other mainly related to the impact of the change in asset mix away from equities to bonds and the impact on future costs related to policyholder compensation mentioned above. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The main component of the positive variance on long-term investments was the impact of a hedge program related to traditional policies with profit sharing and unit linked
policies with guarantees. This was partially offset by the adverse impacts from lower equity markets and lower fees on separate account business. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">For economic assumption changes, the reduction in fixed interest rates had a substantial adverse impact, particularly for Pensions. There was a partial offset here from
higher credit spreads. The impact of changes to discount rate and equity returns were small and largely offsetting. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The miscellaneous impacts reflected a combination of modeling improvements and a change in S&amp;P requirements. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 11 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>United Kingdom </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value operating margin on a constant currency basis was 13.7%. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The in-force variance included a small positive from persistency. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">While the lapse experience observed in 2008 was better than expected some adverse experience is anticipated in the shorter term. As a result a lapse provision was established
to allow for continuing adverse persistency rates in 2010 and this was the principal component of the change in operating assumptions. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The other significant component of the operating return of 13.7% was the strong contribution from new business which generated more than 6%. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Falling market values were the main component of the variance from long-term investment returns, in particular resulting in lower fees. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">On economic assumptions, the adverse impact of a higher discount rate and a lower risk free fixed interest return was partially offset by higher credit spreads.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Miscellaneous covers a refinement in the S&amp;P capital calculation and a smaller impact from modeling improvements. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Asia </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value operating margin on a constant currency basis was (3.6)%. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The in-force variance arose from a negative impact from adverse persistency in Taiwan and exceptional expenses in China. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The change in operating assumptions was mainly due to a change in assumed persistency and maintenance expenses in Taiwan. The changes under other were mainly tax related in
Taiwan. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The significant negative change in economic assumptions was almost entirely due to the reduction in fixed interest rates in Taiwan. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Central and Eastern Europe </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value operating margin was 16.6%. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The most significant item under in-force variance related to adverse persistency in Hungary and Poland, expense overruns including those linked to development costs for the
newer countries, offset partially by a combination of spread experience and higher than expected premiums in Hungary and Poland. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Changes to operating assumptions saw positive mortality changes in Hungary and Slovakia, improved funding margins from mortgages in Hungary and increased asset charges in
Poland more than offset by persistency in Hungary and higher expenses across most countries. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The variance in long-term investment return related to a combination of equity returns and fixed interest rates - the change in assumptions was almost entirely driven by the
higher discount rate. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The largest component of miscellaneous relates to moving the Polish pension funds from IFRS to covered business with the loss of a goodwill component under embedded value.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Other European Countries </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value operating margin was 3.2% </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The in-force variance was adversely affected by higher levels of withdrawals and lower top up rates for existing policies in Spain. To the extent that they are expected to
re-occur, these items were reflected in operating assumption changes. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">On changes in economic assumptions the main components of the adverse variance were higher discount rate and lower risk free rates. The main driver of long term investment
variance was market falls resulting in a reduction in fees. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Value of new business </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Value of new business represents the value created by new business sold during the reporting period. Table 9 links this value to modeled written premium</FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">6</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 9 </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#cccccc" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#cccccc"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="3" VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1px solid #005cae" BGCOLOR="#cccccc">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#cccccc"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" BGCOLOR="#cccccc"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>17.8%</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:3px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In the Americas, VNB increased 4% in US dollars (down 3% in euros). The main contributors to this were Life, Fixed Annuities
and Pensions. For Fixed Annuities the increase, driven by higher sales, included a reduction to reflect higher than normal liquidity in the asset portfolio. Overall IRR in the Americas decreased slightly from 13.0% in 2007 to 12.4% in 2008.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The decrease in VNB in the Netherlands reflected a small increase in sales, offset by a reduction in margins in Pensions due to the very competitive market. The IRR
in the Netherlands increased very slightly from 10.7% in 2007 to 10.8% in 2008 mainly due to a change in the mix of business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The increase in VNB in the UK was
driven by the movement in product mix towards higher margin products, such as annuities and protection business, with partial offset from slightly lower sales growth in the Pensions area. VNB was also adversely impacted by currency with growth in
sterling up 19%. The VNB growth was also reflected in an improved IRR from 13.0% in 2007 to 13.5% in 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The decrease in VNB in Asia reflected substantially lower
production in Taiwan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The growth in VNB within Central and Eastern Europe reflected the strong performance from Slovakia and the first year inclusion of Romania.
This was partially offset by lower VNB, driven by lower sales, in Poland. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The key driver of the lower VNB in respect of Other European Countries was reduced margins
in both Spain and France. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_10"></A>5. &nbsp;Sensitivities </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Table 11 and table 12 reflect the impact of changing the underlying assumptions on the EVLI and the VNB respectively. In each sensitivity scenario, only the stated assumption(s)
has been changed, while keeping other assumptions equal to the &#145;base case&#146;. However, any discretionary elements or policyholder behavior assumptions directly impacted by the changed assumption (e.g. bonus rates or dynamic lapses) are
assumed to vary with the scenario, if appropriate. The base case relates to the embedded value life insurance, i.e. to the value of the modeled life business. The sensitivity results include the impact on the allowances for financial options and
guarantees. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_11"></A>5.1 &nbsp;Embedded value life insurance sensitivity </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 11 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">2%</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The impact of the change in discount rate on the value of the business depends on the timing of the future profits: the
higher the average remaining duration, the higher the sensitivity and the asymmetry to changes in discount rates. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The difference in sensitivity to changes in
investment returns between the regions mainly reflects the composition of the different in-force life portfolios and asset allocations. The asymmetry in sensitivity to investment returns can be attributed to the minimum guarantees in many products.
As a result of these guarantees, future lower investment returns will not be fully offset by equally lower crediting rates. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 15 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Asia shows an asymmetric value change for the decrease and increase in investment returns. This reflects the level of guarantees
underlying much of the business in Taiwan. However, the impact is much higher than last year, reflecting the substantial reduction in assumed investment returns in the base case.. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_12"></A>5.2 &nbsp;Value of new business sensitivity </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 12 </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">9%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="1">5% decrease in mortality/ morbidity rates for longevity exposure business</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="1">10% decrease in acquisition expenses</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">8%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="middle" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">10% decrease in maintenance expenses</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">6%</FONT> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">15%</FONT> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">4%</FONT> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">2%</FONT> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">6%</FONT> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">2%</FONT> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">6%</FONT> <P STYLE="font-size:2px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"
align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In general, the value of new business is more sensitive to changes in parameters than the in-force. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">A relatively small change in future profits can have a relatively large impact on a small VNB compared to the EVLI. The exception is Taiwan where the new business mix does not
include the products with guarantees which gave rise to the high sensitivities seen for the in-force portfolio. The size and sign of the sensitivities depend on the profitability of the individual products as well as the composition of the new
business portfolio within a region. However it should be noted that these sensitivities do not provide indication of future new business profitability under alternative conditions, as no allowance is made for the potential to re-price products.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 16 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa22170_13"></A>Addendum 1: Movement analysis per region and product segment </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">This addendum splits the movement analysis into product segments for AEGON as a whole and for the different regions. First, the AEGON total split by reporting segment is presented
in euro and then the movement of the six regions per reporting segment is stated in euro except for the Americas and the United Kingdom which are stated in local currency with only the opening and closing value and the value of the other activities
translated into euro. The product segments are in line with the updated product segments used for primary financial reporting under IFRS. </FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(A)</SUP></I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I>Embedded value operating margin is calculated on a constant currency basis. See tables 14 to 19 for details. </I></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(B)</SUP></I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I>APE = recurring premium + 1/10 single premium. </I></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TR BGCOLOR="#cccccc">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Movement analysis 2008</B></FONT></TD>
