<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_22"></A>Addendum 3: Recoverability of DPAC </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">This section discusses a number of differences between embedded value and the accounting treatment of deferred policy acquisition costs (DPAC), including value of business
acquired (VOBA), with the aim of linking embedded value to DPAC. The DPAC analyzed here is on an IFRS basis. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Policy acquisition costs are deferred to the extent
that they are recoverable from future expense charges in the premiums or from expected gross profits, depending on the nature of the contract. Every year the DPAC are tested by country unit and product line to assess the recoverability. Included in
DPAC is the VOBA resulting from acquisitions, which is equal to a proportion of the present value of estimated future profits on insurance policies in-force related to business acquired at the time of the acquisition and is in its nature the same as
deferred policy acquisition costs and also subject to the same recoverability testing. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Differences between the assessment of embedded value and DPAC/VOBA, include,
but are not limited to, the following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">DPAC/VOBA in most countries is based on different accounting assumptions from those used in EVLI </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">DPAC/VOBA should be compared to IFRS profits instead of local statutory profits, on which EVLI is based </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">DPAC/VOBA under IFRS is reported pre-tax; EVLI is on an after tax basis </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">In the Netherlands and Poland, DPAC/VOBA is reflected in EVLI, where it is an admissible asset. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Under the EV framework, <I>the present value of future
profits</I> (PVFP) represents the present value of future after tax regulatory profits projected to emerge from business in the current life insurance portfolio, discounted at the embedded value discount rate. For the reasons explained above, this
PVFP cannot be compared directly to the DPAC/VOBA. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">To arrive at a comparable basis, the profits included in the PVFP are adjusted to represent the present value of
future pre-tax IFRS profits, before DPAC/VOBA amortization and discounted at the earned rate, net of investment charges/ expenses. The outcome of this calculation is compared to outstanding DPAC/VOBA balances to give an indication of the extent to
which the aggregate DPAC/VOBA is recoverable. However, it should be noted that actual DPAC/VOBA recoverability testing does not occur in aggregate but rather at a lower level of segmentation and hence accelerated amortization may be required from
time to time on specific blocks or segments of business even though ample coverage exists in aggregate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Table 21 shows that total life insurance DPAC/VOBA has a
coverage ratio of 186%. All of the regions showed coverage ratios above 100%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 21 </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="61%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cccccc">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>DPAC
recoverability</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><I>(amounts in EUR millions, pre tax)</I></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Americas</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>The<BR>Netherlands</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>United<BR>Kingdom</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Asia</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Central&nbsp;and<BR>Eastern<BR>Europe</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Other<BR>European<BR>Countries</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Total<BR>2008</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">Adjusted PVFP</FONT></P></TD>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_23"></A>Addendum 4: Exchange rates </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The currency exchange rates used in this report are reflected below. The weighted average exchange rates are used for the amounts in the movement analysis whereas the closing
exchange rates are used for the year&#150;end 2008 and 2007 amounts. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 22 </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_24"></A>Addendum 5: Methodology </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_25"></A>Scope </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Each division in each country unit
calculates the <I>embedded value life insurance</I> (EVLI) for the relevant product segments within the life insurance entities (<I>life business</I>) based on detailed actuarial calculations. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">All business not included in the life entities, such as general insurance, A&amp;H in non-life entities and banking products is referred to as <I>other activities</I>. All
business in non-life entities is valued at IFRS book value. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The sum of the embedded value life insurance per region and the value of the other activities is
referred to as <I>total embedded value per region</I>. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The adjustments in respect of the holding activities comprise two parts: </FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Debt, capital securities and other net liabilities included at their market values; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The present value of future after tax holding expenses, representing the expenses incurred by the group staff departments which are not allocated to the country units.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The sum of the total embedded value per region and the adjustment in respect of the holding activities represents the <I>total embedded value</I>
(TEV). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The total embedded value less the value of the preferred share capital represents the <I>total embedded value attributable to common shareholders</I>. The
preferred share capital is valued by discounting the expected dividends at the <I>weighted average cost of capital</I> (WACC). This amount is then reduced by 5% to represent a liquidity discount adjustment. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 28 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_26"></A>Methodology and definitions </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Calculation of the embedded value life insurance requires a considerable number of assumptions to be set with respect to both expected operational and economic developments. The
principles developed by AEGON to calculate its embedded value life insurance and value of new business are intended to reflect industry best practices for the purpose of supplementary reporting. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Embedded value life insurance </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value life insurance
only reflects the value that arises from current business (assuming a closed book) and therefore does not include a value for future new business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded
value life insurance is built up from the following components: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="28%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="1%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="55%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="text-indent:2.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>EVLI</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>=</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Free surplus</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ROWSPAN="2" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae">}</FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ROWSPAN="2"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Adjusted net worth</B></FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>+</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Required surplus</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="8"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>+</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Present value of future profits</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ROWSPAN="2" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae">}</FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="middle" ROWSPAN="2"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Value of in-force life business</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>&#150;</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Cost of capital</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The EVLI is defined as the adjusted net worth (ANW) plus value of in-force life business
(ViF)</FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">7</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">ANW
represents the market value of available assets in excess of liabilities determined on the local regulatory basis. ANW is split between <I>required surplus</I> and <I>free surplus</I>. Required surplus represents assets required to be present in the
company to support the in-force life business (solvency requirement). Assets backing required surplus are marked-to-market. Free surplus represents assets available at the valuation date that are not required to support the in-force life business,
and is the excess of assets over the sum of the liabilities (on the regulatory basis) and the required surplus. Assets backing free surplus are marked-to-market. Refer to table 5 for a reconciliation of the total capital base to ANW. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The ViF equals the <I>present value of future profits</I> (PVFP) less the <I>cost of capital</I> (CoC). The PVFP represents the present value of future after tax regulatory
profits projected to emerge from business in the current life insurance portfolio discounted at the discount rate. The discount rate both reflects the time value of money and a risk margin. The CoC originates from the fact that solvency requirements
will constrain distributions to shareholders while earning a net return less than the discount rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The cost of capital depends on the level of required surplus
and affects the EVLI. The higher the required surplus, the greater the CoC and this switch from free surplus to required surplus results in a lower EVLI. The AEGON internal requirement is based on the higher of the local minimum regulatory
requirements and Standard and Poors&#146; local capital adequacy models at AA level, plus any additional internally imposed requirements, if applicable (internal basis). The exception is AEGON&#146;s partnership in France, La Mondiale
Participations, which is managed on local regulatory requirements, which then also forms the basis for the solvency requirements for that business throughout this report. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">For comparison purposes, addendum 2 includes the embedded value components and the embedded value life insurance per country unit on the regulatory surplus basis. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:72px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">7</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"> Alternatively, the sum of the required surplus and present value of future profits less the cost of capital is also known as the present value
of distributable earnings (PVDE). The value of the free surplus plus the PVDE then equals the embedded value life insurance. </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 29 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Movement analysis including new business </I></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">A movement analysis illustrates the change in embedded value life insurance from one reporting period to the next. One of the components of the movement analysis is the value of
new business (VNB). The VNB is a measure of the value added by production sold within the last reporting period. It is calculated at the end of the reporting period and based on the beginning of year economic assumptions and assumptions outside of
management control, and end of year operating assumptions. The change to end of year economic assumptions is reflected under &#145;change in economic assumptions&#146;, while the difference between the assumed and actual investment experience is
reflected in the &#145;variance from long-term investment return&#146;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Where pre-tax numbers are presented, the calculations are carried out on an after tax basis
and the profits are then grossed up for the relevant corporate tax rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_27"></A>Operating assumptions </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Operating assumptions are best estimate assumptions and based on historical data where available. The assumptions fall into two categories: operating assumptions involving
policyholder behavior and operating assumptions involving company policies, strategies and operations. All assumptions reflect a going concern basis. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3"
COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Operating assumptions involving policyholder behavior </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Operating assumptions involving policyholder behavior, such as premium
contributions, mortality, morbidity and persistency, reflect the company&#146;s &#145;best estimate&#146; of future experience and are based on the historical and current experience of the company. These assumptions are adjusted to reflect known
changes in the environment and identifiable trends. If historical data is insufficient to provide a reliable basis to develop assumptions, the company&#146;s best judgment is used taking into consideration the company&#146;s pricing and/or reserving
assumptions and the experience of other companies with comparable products, markets and operating procedures. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Operating assumptions involving
company policies, strategies and operations </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Operating assumptions involving company policies, strategies and operations, such as profit sharing/bonus rates
and reinsurance and investment/reinvestment strategies reflect contractual requirements as well as the most current policies, strategies and operations. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Consistent
with the close matching approach implemented in 2004, the estate of Guardian Assurance in AEGON UK has been valued assuming its distribution as terminal bonus. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2">Allowances for tax reflect best estimates of future taxes according to local taxation rules, taking into account current &#145;substantially enacted&#146; legislation and tax rates. This best estimate of future taxes initially assumes no
future new business (i.e. is on a closed book basis) and includes both cash and accrual adjustments (e.g., deferred taxes). The tax attributed to new business written in the year is generally determined by considering the marginal impact of that new
business on the existing business tax position (allowing for any losses carried forward). For the UK, the tax attributable to new business assumes that existing business profits are first made available to relieve new business strains, with any
balance of such profits then being used to relieve carried forward losses. The UK new business strains and current tax position of the fund thus generate a negative tax variance, which has been included under &#145;in-force variance&#146; in the
movement analysis in section 4.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 30 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Expenses are based on current experience &#150; in the Netherlands this is current budgeted expenses as they
are considered a more appropriate indicator of future levels. Expenses that can clearly be demonstrated as non-recurring are identified and omitted from maintenance or acquisition costs and excluded from the determination of the appropriate unit
expense assumptions. Expenses are subject to inflation adjustments into the future</FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">8</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">. Holding expenses
reflect the present value of expected future expenses incurred by the holding companies (<I>present value holding expenses</I>). These expenses are assumed to run off in line with the in-force life business. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The target investment mix assumed does not vary with different scenarios. Where the current investment mix is different from the target, the target mix is modeled to be reached
over a period of time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Operating assumptions are reviewed each year and a determination is made as to whether they should be changed. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_28"></A>Economic assumptions </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Economic assumptions used
in the embedded value are based on observable market data and projections of future trends. These assumptions are approved by the Executive Board. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3"
COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Risk discount rate </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The discount rates used in embedded value reflect AEGON&#146;s <I>weighted average cost of capital</I> (WACC). From
the WACC, we derive an AEGON risk margin as the difference between the WACC and weighted current risk free rates across the major country units. The WACC is calculated using a combination of a group level risk free interest rate, an equity risk
premium, an assessment of company risk (beta) and an allowance for the gearing impact of debt financing. Rigid adherence to such an approach can result in inappropriate volatility in the WACC and the derived AEGON risk margin, for example as a
result of short-term movements in beta. In 2004 and 2005 the AEGON risk margin was 3.2%. In 2006 and 2007 it was concluded that, taking into account changes in the beta and the level of debt financing, 3.0% would be a more appropriate allowance for
an AEGON group wide risk margin. The analysis in 2008 has reflected a similar approach but has recognized that an increase in the equity risk premium is appropriate. In previous years the cost of equity has been in the range 8% to 9%. This year a
figure of 10.5% has been assumed, which results in an increase in the risk margin from 3% to 4%. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Discount rates are then calculated at a country unit level to
reflect the AEGON risk margin and the country risk free rate assumption. Where risk free rates are projected to move from current market rates to an ultimate long-term rate, the risk margin is applied to a blended rate to arrive at a single risk
discount rate. In previous years no adjustment was made to discount rates among the three major country units to reflect differences in business risk either at country level or business unit/product level. This year the substantial de-risking of the
Netherlands business was recognized and this lead to the inclusion of a risk margin of 3% for the Netherlands &#150; in line with 2007 and 1% below the US and the UK. It should also be noted that, specific risk factors within each of these three
countries will be reflected in the reserves set at a local level. An allowance for specific risk factors in the new/smaller country units is included in the discount rates where appropriate. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Equity return </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The method used to derive projected equity returns
is similar to that used to derive risk discount rates. As in previous years this method has resulted in the assumption of equity returns at the same level as discount rates. This includes the Netherlands, even though the lower risk premium
applicable to this business could have supported an approach where they exceeded the discount rate to achieve consistency of equity returns across euro economies. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:72px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:3px;"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">8</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"> Refer to addendum 6 for the inflation assumptions. </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 31 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Risk free fixed interest returns </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Risk free fixed interest returns correspond to the government bond yield for ten-year fixed interest instruments. These returns are used to derive risk discount rates and also underlie projections of returns on reinvestments,
which will vary by the duration and credit characteristics of the assumed investment policy. In the Americas, the Eurozone and Taiwan, the assumed returns grade from the current market levels to the long-term assumptions &#150; derived from the
forward curve - over a period of approximately five years. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_29"></A>Embedded options and guarantees </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Insurance policies can have options and guarantees that are embedded in the product design (<I>embedded options and guarantees</I>). These embedded options and guarantees include
minimum guaranteed death/income benefits, minimum interest guarantees (<I>floors</I>), minimum (cash) surrender values, annuity options, etc. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">An explicit allowance
for the time value of all material embedded options and guarantees has been included by assessing their impact on embedded value life insurance using mostly stochastic modeling. The methodology and assumptions used to assess this for the two regions
where the impact on the EVLI is material are described in addendum 6. In total, the time value of options and guarantees included in the EVLI for the Group was EUR 592&nbsp;million, after tax. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">As well as the explicit cost included for the time value of embedded options and guarantees, the PVFP for the Netherlands includes a positive value of EUR 1.3 billion in relation
to the release of EUR 3.8 billion IFRS reserve held for financial options and guarantees, and which is backed by an economic hedging program. This value has been established by projecting the future releases to shareholders from the reserve,
assuming the underlying assets earn a risk free return, and discounting the releases, net of 25.5% tax, at the risk discount rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_30">
</A>Required capital </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The solvency requirement underlying the cost of capital allowance in the embedded value is the internal surplus requirement on which the
business is managed. This requirement is based on the more stringent of the local regulatory requirement and the Standard and Poors&#146; local capital adequacy models at a AA level plus any additional internally imposed requirements, if applicable.
The exception is AEGON&#146;s partnership in France, La Mondiale Participations, which is managed on local regulatory requirements. This then forms the basis for the solvency requirements for that business throughout this report. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">In addition, embedded value figures calculated using the regulatory surplus requirement are shown in table 20, in addendum 2. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_31"></A>Addendum 6: Detailed economic assumptions </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 23 </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cccccc">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-TOP:1px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"
COLOR="#005cae"><B>Economic</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>assumptions 2008</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>Americas </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL"
SIZE="2"><I>Stochastic modeling methodology </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The embedded value is taken as the average of the values calculated over a range of stochastic scenarios. The risk
discount rate used in each scenario is described in table 4. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Scenarios for general account products </I></FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Treasury yield curve scenarios </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">These scenarios model the US treasury
yield curve. The underlying dynamics of the scenario generator are lognormal, with mean reversion to the assumed interest rate levels as described in table 4 as well as further adjustments in the event that the rates become too extreme. A short
maturity (90-day) and long maturity (10-year) rate are projected. For both rates a quarterly volatility, a mean reversion target, and a mean reversion factor are specified, as well as a correlation between the movements of the two projected rates.
Volatilities (standard deviations) are based on historical data. The net credit spreads are not assumed to vary by scenario. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 24 </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="45%" BORDER="0">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><FONT FACE="WINGDINGS 2">&#191;</FONT></FONT><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Equity scenarios </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Common stock and preferred stock account for less than
2% of the total AEGON USA general account assets. Therefore, these are not modeled separately. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Scenarios for separate account products </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">These scenarios cover various classes of equities and fixed income investments (bonds, money markets) as benchmarks for separate account funds. The underlying dynamics of the
generator are lognormal, with inputs of expected returns and volatilities for each fund class as well as correlations between fund classes. Volatilities and correlations between funds are based on historical data. The current economic environment
and forward-looking assumptions as per the dividend discount model were used to determine expected annual returns. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Within the stochastic scenarios, non-economic
assumptions such as lapses are modeled dynamically. No management behavior is modeled. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 25 </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="7%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cccccc">
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Stochastic
modeling</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>assumptions</B></FONT></P></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">Money market</FONT></P> <P

<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">0.22</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">0.16</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">1.00</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(A)</SUP> Correlations in this
table are with respect to correlations of returns. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B><I>The Netherlands </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Stochastic modeling methodology </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The allowance in embedded value for the minimum interest guarantees in the life insurance portfolio
(traditional business, unit-linked portfolios and separate account contracts) is calculated stochastically, where applicable. The impact of the financial options is calculated using the average values of the future after-tax shortfalls and
profit-sharing over a range of stochastic scenarios, discounted using the risk discount rate described in table 4. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Within the stochastic scenarios non-economic
assumptions are based on best estimates. No management behavior is modeled. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Scenarios for general account products </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Profit sharing is mainly driven by an externally defined basket of government bonds. Therefore, no equity return or correlation assumptions are required to assess the exposure to
the financial options and guarantees embedded in the traditional products. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">At year-end 2008, the book yield on this basket equaled 3.93%. To assess the value of the
minimum guarantees, a mean reversion target return of 4.34% is assumed for this benchmark. Projected interest rate scenarios are specified taking into account correlation between successive years, the mean reversion target and volatility. The model
volatility is related to the implied volatility of the 7-year yield as an approximation of the actual volatility of the profit-sharing benchmark. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 27 </I>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="35%" BORDER="0">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="84%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="5%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="5%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cccccc">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="5" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-TOP:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px; padding-right:8px" BGCOLOR="#cccccc"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#005cae"><B>Stochastic
modeling mean reversion targets</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cccccc">
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px" BGCOLOR="#cccccc">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:2px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"
COLOR="#005cae"><B>Annual&nbsp;yield<BR>volatility</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" align="left">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">4.34%</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">16.4%</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Scenarios for unit-linked and separate account pension products </I></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The unit-linked portfolio and separate account pension contracts are backed by a mix of equities and fixed income investments. The underlying dynamics of the scenario generators
are lognormal, with inputs of expected returns and volatilities as well as the correlation matrix. The tables that follow include the mix of the underlying assets, the expected returns, volatilities per asset class and the assumed correlations for
each of the unit-linked and separate account products. Volatilities and correlations between asset classes are based on historical data. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">2.10%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">3.70%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">5</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-left:8px"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">Property <SUP
STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(A)</SUP></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">1.0%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">21.60%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">16.00%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:2px solid #005cae; BORDER-BOTTOM:3px solid #005cae; padding-right:8px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1">5</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:4px;"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(A) </SUP>The expected returns
used in stochastic modeling for these asset classes are the same as in table 23. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"><I>Table 31 </I></FONT></P> <P

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_32"></A>Glossary and abbreviations </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="3" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_33"></A>Glossary </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Base case</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The EVLI, TEV and VNB calculated under the set of assumptions and methodology outlined in addendum 5 Methodology. Sensitivity tests reflecting a deviation on the assumptions are presented in comparison to
the base case.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Closed book</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">An assumption that the portfolio will run off after the valuation date and is not expected to grow with future new business.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Cost of capital</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The cost related to having to hold solvency capital that will constrain distributions to shareholders. The cost originates from the fact that the net return earned on the assets backing this capital is
lower than the discount rate.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Discount rate</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The rate at which future cash flows are discounted back to the valuation date.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Embedded options and</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"
COLOR="#005cae">guarantees</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Can apply to both assets and liabilities of AEGON. On assets, refers to features such as the ability to exercise an option to call, put, prepay or convert an asset. On liabilities, refers to features such
as minimum guaranteed death/income benefits, minimum interest guarantees (floors), minimum (cash) surrender values, annuity options, etc.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Embedded value life</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"
COLOR="#005cae">insurance</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The present value of the existing life insurance business at the valuation date and excluding any value attributable to future new business.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Embedded value life</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">insurance
movement</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The change in embedded value life insurance from one reporting year to another.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Embedded value</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">operating
margin</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Return on embedded value life insurance from operating activities. Defined as embedded value operating return divided by beginning of year embedded value life insurance (after any beginning of year
adjustments) on a constant currency basis.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Embedded value</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">operating
return</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Embedded value life insurance earnings from operating activities. Defined as the value of new business plus in-force performance.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Embedded value total</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">margin</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Return on embedded value life insurance from all sources. Defined as embedded value total return divided by beginning of year embedded value (after any beginning of year adjustments) in
euros.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Embedded value total</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">return</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Embedded value life insurance earnings from all sources, not including capital movements. Defined as embedded value operating return plus the variance from long-term investment return, changes in economic
assumptions, currency exchange differences and miscellaneous impacts.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">European Embedded</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Value
Principles</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">A consistent framework for the calculation and reporting of embedded value published in May 2004 by the CFO Forum, a group representing the Chief Financial Officers of major European
insurers.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 37 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Free surplus</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Excess of assets available at the valuation date over capital needed to support the business (liabilities and required surplus).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Going concern basis</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Business outlook assumption that expects the business to behave under normal conditions but excluding the value generated by future new business.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Gross value of new</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">business</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The value of new business, grossed-up at the effective new business corporate tax rate, before allowance for the cost of capital.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">In-force business</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Contracts and policies that are in effect as at the valuation date.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">In-force performance</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Defined as unwinding discount rate plus current-year experience variance from non-economic assumptions within management control plus change in operating assumptions.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Internal rate of return</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The discount rate at which the present value of the distributable earnings from new business equals the investment in new business, i.e. the projected return on the initial investment in new business.
</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Internal surplus basis</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The more stringent of local regulatory solvency requirements and Standard and Poors&#146; (S&amp;P) solvency requirements at AA level, plus any additional internally imposed requirements, if applicable.
</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">International Financial</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Reporting
Standards</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">A set of accounting standards developed by the International Accounting Standards Board. All publicly listed companies in the European Union are required to prepare their financial statements in
conformity with IFRS beginning January 1, 2005.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">IFRS book value</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Net asset value based on international financial reporting standards.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Mark-to-market</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The adjustment of the asset value from regulatory value to market value.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Movement analysis</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">An explanation of the change in embedded value life insurance from one reporting period to the next.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Net asset spreads</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Excess of net investment return over the risk free rate.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Persistency</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The rate at which policies and contracts remain in-force.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Present value of</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">distributable
earnings</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The discounted value of expected future distributable earnings as at the valuation date at the discount rate.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Present value of new</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">business
premiums</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The discounted value of modeled premiums on the block of business sold in the latest reporting year.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Present value of future</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2"
COLOR="#005cae">profits</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The present value of future after tax regulatory profits projected to emerge from business in the current life insurance portfolio, discounted at the embedded value discount rate.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Reporting segment</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The product type categories of business on which AEGON reports externally for IFRS and EVLI/TEV.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 38 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="18%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="80%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Required surplus</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The capital that AEGON is required to hold in order to satisfy local regulatory solvency requirements or to demonstrate financial strength (via ratings from agencies such as Standard &amp; Poors&#146; and
Moody&#146;s).</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Reserve base</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Methodology or principle basis to calculate the level of reserves.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Total embedded value</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The sum of the embedded value life insurance and the value of the other activities and holding activities.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Time value of money</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The expected value of money at a certain valuation date.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Unwind of discount</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Expected return on the beginning of year EVLI.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Value of new business</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The present value of the future distributable earnings on the block of business sold in the latest reporting year. Value of new business is calculated using beginning of year economic assumptions and
assumptions outside of management control, and end of year operating assumptions.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Value of in-force</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The present value of the expected future profits emerging from the business in-force as of the valuation date minus the cost of capital.</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD HEIGHT="16"></TD>
<TD HEIGHT="16" COLSPAN="2"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">Variance analysis</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Explanation of the difference between actual and expected experience related to assumptions.</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="51%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="2%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Embedded value 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">- 39 -&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">RS</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">VA</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Variable annuities</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">ViF</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">Value of in-force business</FONT></TD></TR>

<TD VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae">VNB</FONT></TD>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="5" COLOR="#005cae"><B><A NAME="txa30790_35"></A>Disclaimers </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B><U>Cautionary note regarding Regulation G (non-GAAP measure) </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">This press release includes a non-GAAP financial
measure. Embedded value is not based on IFRS, which are used to prepare and report AEGON&#146;s 2008 financial statements and should not be viewed as a substitute for IFRS financial measures. In the 2008 Embedded Value report available on
www.aegon.com, the embedded value life insurance and the total embedded value are reconciled to shareholders&#146; equity of EUR 6.1 billion as reported in AEGON&#146;s annual accounts over the year 2008. AEGON believes the non-GAAP measure shown
herein, together with the GAAP information, provides a meaningful measure for the investment community to evaluate AEGON&#146;s business relative to the businesses of our peers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B><U>Local currencies and constant currency exchange rates </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">This press release contains certain information about our
results and financial condition in USD for the Americas and GBP for the United Kingdom, because those businesses operate and are managed primarily in those currencies. Certain comparative information presented on a constant currency basis eliminates
the effects of changes in currency exchange rates. None of this information is a substitute for or superior to financial information about us presented in EUR, which is the currency of our primary financial statements. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#005cae"><B><U>Forward-looking statements </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="ARIAL" SIZE="2">The statements contained in this press
release that are not historical facts are forward-looking statements as defined in the US Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. The following are words that identify such forward-looking statements: believe, estimate, target, intend,
may, expect, anticipate, predict, project, counting on, plan, continue, want, forecast, should, would, is confident, will, and similar expressions as they relate to our company. These statements are not guarantees of future performance and involve
risks, uncertainties and assumptions that are difficult to predict. We undertake no obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking statements. Readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements, which
merely reflect company expectations at the time of writing. Actual results may differ materially from expectations conveyed in forward-looking statements due to changes caused by various risks and uncertainties. Such risks and uncertainties include
but are not limited to the following: </FONT></P>
